Posts.Content: I have a jelly bean sized lump in my right breast. When I first discovered it 6 months ago, my doctor thought it may have been due to mastitis (as I had just weaned my son around that time). I did the appropriate treatment for mastitis and it did not go away or reduce the size of the lump. I went back for a follow up and my doctor had me do a mammogram and ultrasound of the breast. Both came back negative, however the technician who did the ultrasound said she could very distinctly feel the lump and I overheard her talking to the mammogram tech about how unusual it was for her to be able to feel it but not see anything. The radiologist advised that I keep an eye on it and see if it changed in size, and if I noticed anything different to schedule another appointment. I'm pretty sure that it is still the same size as it was 6 months ago, however I can feel another lump that is slightly smaller (maybe pea sized) about 5 centimeters away from the first one. Both are sensitive [painful] to touch. Is this common to breast cancer? I'm only 25 with no known history of breast cancer in my family. It seems unlikely, but I'm worried about the development of another lump.
Posts.Title: Have Other Women Experienced This With Lumps in the Breast?
